(1 comment)

These probably shouldn't be defined as global variables. Should they be defined in the PLDMInstanceManager class? Should that class be a singleton for accessing them? Or can they just be passed into the functions they're needed?
Acknowledged
If this is replacing the util::dbus::getPldmInstanceID function, might as well remove the old one to avoid confusion.
Done
is '-' really needed?

I believe it is needed as 
the negative sign is part of the return value convention used by system calls to indicate failure. The error codes like EAGAIN are set in the global errno variable when the return value is -1, and these error codes help you determine the exact reason for the failure.
Without the negative sign, it would be difficult to differentiate between success (positive values or 0) and failure (negative values), so it is indeed needed for proper error reporting and handling.
This seems redundant with the other call to freePLDMInstanceID being made if sendPldm fails.
Acknowledged
This local variable would just be used in this context over the global one added above.
Acknowledged
Does freePLDMInstanceID also need to be called somewhere here in the good path? Currently it's only being called in error paths.
Done
What's the purpose of this class? It looks like it's just defining the two functions to be used in it's constructor and destructor and I don't see an instance of the class being created anywhere.
My bad, missed creating the class instance and yes I  created the instance of the class.
